faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: What is VAT in the UAE, and who needs to register?
items.answer: VAT is a 5% consumption tax introduced by the UAE government. Any business with an annual turnover exceeding AED 375,000 must register, though smaller businesses can opt for voluntary registration.

items.question: How long does VAT registration take?
items.answer: Typically, it takes a few weeks to register. However, our expert VAT specialists help you secure your VAT registration code within 5-7 business days.

items.question: What documents are required for VAT registration?
items.answer: Typical documents include a trade license, passport copies, Emirates ID, bank account info, and financial records. Our experts help you compile, prepare, and submit the necessary documents for your jurisdiction.

items.question: How often do I need to file VAT returns in the UAE?
items.answer: Most businesses file quarterly, though some may need monthly filing. We ensure timely submissions to help you avoid penalties.

items.question: Can One Nexuz help recover input VAT?
items.answer: Absolutely! Our experts maximize your refunds on business expenses, improving cash flow and reducing financial leakage.
